subdomains.name: Probability Foundations
subdomains.description: The axiomatic framework of probability. Sample spaces, events, and the rules that govern chance.
subdomains.flavor: The First Roll — where randomness meets rigor, and uncertainty finds its laws.

topics.name: Sample Spaces & Events
topics.description: The set of all possible outcomes and the events we care about. The building blocks of probability.
topics.flavor: Every random process begins with a question: what could possibly happen?

topics.name: Probability Axioms
topics.description: Kolmogorov's axioms: non-negativity, normalization, and countable additivity. The foundation of modern probability.
topics.flavor: Three simple rules that tame the chaos of randomness.

topics.name: Conditional Probability
topics.description: The probability of an event given that another event has occurred. Bayes' theorem and independence.
topics.flavor: Knowing something changes everything — or sometimes, nothing at all.

topics.name: Counting Methods
topics.description: Permutations, combinations, and the multiplication principle applied to probability calculations.
topics.flavor: Before you can find the odds, you must count the possibilities.

topics.name: Law of Total Probability
topics.description: Partitioning sample spaces to compute probabilities. The bridge between conditional and unconditional probability.
topics.flavor: Break the whole into parts, and the answer reveals itself.

subdomains.name: Probability Distributions
subdomains.description: The shapes of randomness. Discrete and continuous distributions that model real-world phenomena.
subdomains.flavor: The Gallery of Chance — each distribution a portrait of a different kind of randomness.

topics.name: Discrete Distributions
topics.description: Bernoulli, binomial, Poisson, geometric. Distributions for countable outcomes.
topics.flavor: Coins, dice, and counts — the discrete face of randomness.

topics.name: Continuous Distributions
topics.description: Normal, exponential, uniform, gamma. Distributions for measurements on a continuum.
topics.flavor: The bell curve and its cousins — smooth landscapes of probability.

topics.name: Expected Value & Variance
topics.description: The mean and spread of a random variable. Moments that capture the essence of a distribution.
topics.flavor: What do you expect? And how surprised should you be?

topics.name: Joint Distributions
topics.description: Multiple random variables together. Marginal distributions, covariance, and correlation.
topics.flavor: When two random variables dance together, their relationship matters.

topics.name: Moment Generating Functions
topics.description: A powerful tool for characterizing distributions. Transforms that encode all moments.
topics.flavor: A single function that remembers everything about a distribution.

subdomains.name: Statistical Inference
subdomains.description: Drawing conclusions from data. Estimation, hypothesis testing, and confidence intervals.
subdomains.flavor: The Observatory — where data meets theory, and evidence guides belief.

topics.name: Point Estimation
topics.description: Maximum likelihood, method of moments, and properties of estimators: bias, consistency, efficiency.
topics.flavor: Guessing the truth from a sample — the art of estimation.

topics.name: Confidence Intervals
topics.description: Ranges of plausible values for parameters. Constructing and interpreting interval estimates.
topics.flavor: Not a single guess, but a range of honest uncertainty.

topics.name: Hypothesis Testing
topics.description: Testing claims about populations. Null and alternative hypotheses, p-values, and test statistics.
topics.flavor: The court of statistics — where data testifies for or against a claim.

topics.name: Regression Analysis
topics.description: Modeling relationships between variables. Least squares, residuals, and prediction.
topics.flavor: Drawing the best line through a cloud of points.

topics.name: Bayesian Inference
topics.description: Updating beliefs with data. Prior distributions, likelihood, and posterior inference.
topics.flavor: Belief evolves — each new observation refines what we think we know.

subdomains.name: Stochastic Processes
subdomains.description: Random phenomena evolving over time. From random walks to Markov chains.
subdomains.flavor: The River of Chance — randomness in motion, flowing through time.

topics.name: Random Walks
topics.description: Steps in random directions. The drunkard's walk and its surprising properties.
topics.flavor: One step at a time, going nowhere in particular — yet patterns emerge.

topics.name: Markov Chains
topics.description: Memoryless random processes. Transition matrices, stationary distributions, and ergodicity.
topics.flavor: The future depends only on the present — the past is forgotten.

topics.name: Poisson Processes
topics.description: Random events occurring in continuous time. Arrivals, waiting times, and intensity.
topics.flavor: Phone calls, earthquakes, bus arrivals — events scattered randomly in time.

topics.name: Brownian Motion
topics.description: Continuous random movement. The mathematical model of diffusion and stock prices.
topics.flavor: Pollen grains jittering in water — randomness made continuous and beautiful.

topics.name: Martingales
topics.description: Fair game processes. Sequences where the expected future value equals the present value.
topics.flavor: A perfectly fair game — no strategy can beat pure chance.
